text: a second might of violence in a city
already crackling with tension police
had brought in reinforcements in
anticipation of protests and just before
9 o'clock - trouble erupted as the
evening progressed police responded to
the demonstrators with tear gas and stun
grenades the anger among the marchers
clear to see what precipitated this is
police brutality and you see the end
result of something that happened by our
police force that's supposed to be hard
to protect and serve by the taxpayers
some in the crowd tried to calm things
down but the confrontations went on for
almost three hours many in the black
community simply do not believe the
police account of how 43 year old Keith
Lamont Scott died on Tuesday despite the
authorities urging calm Charlotte has
seen a second night of violence
the mayor is suggesting that curfews may
have to be considered and the governor
has ordered more security forces into
the area the killing of Keith Lamont
Scott has touched a nerve and the
divisions in this community have come
right to the surface garrier Donahue BBC
News Charlotte North Carolina
